intro: Pacisthos gonychila, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Pacisthos gonychila is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
